content.description:
Scramble up a series of ledges below a chimney, then stem through large chockstones to a transition left. Follow ledges & flakes to a steep arete with a delicate crux reach to finish.

Rated 5.9 in the new book, some better holds broke at the top, making it a bit harder.

Scramble up a series of ramps to gain the first bolt. Continue up to a ledge and short, steep face. The climbing is easier above, but still steep enough to be engaging.  At the top, an interesting (but not difficult) mantle move guards the anchors.
content.location: On the far left side of the buttress. The start is above and left of "Selfish Pigdogs".

content.description:
Long, sustained  techy face climbing on a the proudest part of the feature. Mostly 5.10 & 5.11 climbing.

Layback and crimp through a steep, slightly crunchy start to a decent rest under a small overhang. The rest is amazing moves on bullet rock.

Continue up the techy face with the pump building to another OK rest at the top of a small pillar.

Strike out left and up through a a thin reachy bit, then move into the crimp sequence crux (both well-protected).

Once the short finger crack is reached, one can either go left to a slopey hole around the arete, then up; or go straight up the face past another crux.
content.location: The main line on the tall wall between "Tribal Funhogs" and "Crow Bar". Start on the large ledge at the low point of the base.

content.description: 4 star climbing on some questionable rock. Great movement using both crack features and incut face holds leads to a splitter finger to hand crack. A good #3C4 about 25' up on better rock gives you confidence to continue to the .5C4 splitter that slowly widens to hands then a 2 bolt anchor.
content.protection: Single set of cams from .3C4 to a #3C4 with extra .5s and some stoppers.
content.location: Right of the giant chimney. If you find the wall you can't miss the route.

content.description:
Well-bolted steep face. A variety of long moves between crimps and nice rails leads to a short, overhanging headwall. Finish with either a traverse right and a mantle, or go directly up on decent holds and move right (easier).

One of the few summer afternoon shade climbs in the Lower Gorge.
content.location: Just left of the start of Hiraeth. Scramble up a blocky section to a line of bolts on a steep face.

content.description: Step off the platform on the right side to gain the first bolt. Continue up past well-protected fun moves to a stance below a bulge. Hero jugs get you through the steep parts, and a fun lip pull finishes it up.
content.location: Located between "Squawk Patrol" and "Selfish Pigdogs" on the left side of the formation.

content.description: Climb up a large crack/flake system with loose blocks...or not.
content.location: Right of "Hiraeth", scramble up an easy slab to the break.
